name: This is staging (Label your site)
author: Alexander Vasilev

sections.description:
How many times have you worked on the staging of a site and realizing at some point that this is not the development environment?

This plugin will give you the options to add a random (by your choice) text label which might appear in the WordPress admin bar or on the front end. You will be provided with the following settings: * Set your own text for label (instead of the default \”This is Staging\”) * Choose the label to be visible on the front end, admin bar, both or nowhere (but then why you gonna need this) * Pick up the color of the background and the font for the front end * Choose the location of the label on the front end (left-top; left-bottom; right-top; right-bottom) * Add the King Leonidas\’s face on the front end label (or don\’t add it) * Set the visibility (you can keep the label visible only for you, admin role or array a list of users\’ ids)

To access the settigns page go to Settings->This is staging.

You can fork the plugin here: https://bitbucket.org/alordiel/this-is-staging

Any suggestions are welcomed.
